meanings.definition: A drug used to treat high blood pressure by blocking nerve signals to blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed guanethidine to help lower my blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: Patients often take guanethidine to manage their hypertension.
meanings.sent3: After taking guanethidine, I felt like my blood vessels were on vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her blood vessels danced freely after the guanethidine kicked in.
meanings.sent5: The guanethidine worked like a traffic cop, directing the nerve signals away from the blood vessels.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the structure of guanethidine in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Guanethidine has a complex molecular formula.
meanings.sent3: In the chemistry class, we learned about the composition of guanethidine.
meanings.sent4: The guanethidine molecule seemed like a tiny puzzle to the researchers.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, guanethidine appeared like a miniature world of atoms and bonds.
